meanings.definition: Comparative form of the adjective 'burry': covered in or resembling burrs.
meanings.sent1: The hedgehog's spines were the burriest of all.
meanings.sent2: The cactus was the burriest plant in the desert.
meanings.sent3: The velcro was so burriest that it stuck to everything!
meanings.sent4: Her personality was like the burriest thorn, prickly but protective.
meanings.sent5: The burriest fabric felt rough and prickly against my skin.

meanings.definition: Superlative form of the adjective 'burry': most covered in or resembling burrs.
meanings.sent1: Out of all the bushes, the rose bush was the burriest.
meanings.sent2: The burriest tree in the forest was the pine tree.
meanings.sent3: The burriest blanket felt scratchy but cozy.
meanings.sent4: Her words were the burriest, leaving a lasting impact.
meanings.sent5: The burriest path through the thicket was difficult to navigate.

meanings.definition: Comparative form of the adverb 'burly': in a burly manner.
meanings.sent1: He lifted the box burriest, showing his strength.
meanings.sent2: The wrestler moved burriest in the ring.
meanings.sent3: The tiny puppy tried to bark burriest, sounding tough.
meanings.sent4: She ran burriest to catch the bus before it left.
meanings.sent5: The chef chopped the vegetables burriest, with power and precision.

meanings.definition: Superlative form of the adverb 'burly': in the most burly manner.
meanings.sent1: The giant lifted the weights burriest in the gym.
meanings.sent2: The bear roared burriest in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The toddler stomped burriest, trying to be intimidating.
meanings.sent4: The storm raged burriest, with howling winds and pouring rain.
meanings.sent5: The warrior swung his sword burriest, striking down his enemies.
